result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

miscConds.notes:
During the pendency of this deferral, the Defendant agrees to:
-Commit no acts which rise to the level of probable cause in violation of the criminal laws of the state of Wisconsin, or of any other state, or of the United States of America.
-Comply with all conditions of bail or bond in this case.
-Pay a fine of $20 plus the costs of the action.
-Continue existing therapy with the Veterans Administration and provide proof of the completion of the sessions. Continue to have no contact with Victim 1. 
-The parties agree, and the defendant understands, that the conditions of any bail or bond in effect on the plea date shall continue for the entire length of this agreement, and that any violation of the defendant's bond may result in bail jumping charges pursuant to Wis. Stat. 946.49. The defendant further understands that a charged violation of the bail or bond for which probable cause is found shall be a basis for the State to vacate this agreement.
-Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant. 
-If, at any time during the deferral period, the defendant has no complied with the conditions of this agreement, the State may at its discretion and upon notice the defendant, revoke the agreement and move the Court to enter judgment of conviction and the parties shall proceed to sentencing. At sentencing, the State shall be free to argue for any disposition it deems appropriate, up to and including the maximum sentence provided by law. 
-Except as otherwise provided in this agreement, the State must prove non-compliance with thus agreement by the preponderance of the evidence at a hearing subject to Wis. Stat. 911.01(4)(c).
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

-At the end of this deferral period or upon completion of all terms of this agreement, whichever is later, if the defendant has complied with the conditions of this agreement and provided proof of compliance when required, the State will move to dismiss this count with prejudice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derick Matthew Ehrlichmann

records.addlTxt: 1:38 PM Defendant Derick Matthew Ehrlichmann appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan Sr. appeared by video for Derick Matthew Ehrlichmann.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State submits corrected DJOC. Defendant to enter plea on amended Count 2 - The Domestic Abuse modified to be struck. Count 1 to be dismissed. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Attorney Mulligan is in agreement. Defendant pleads no contest to charge. Court verbally goes through plea questionnaire with defendant. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. Victim Witness Coordinator makes statement on behalf of Victim. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is deferred pursuant to the terms of the agreement.
Signed Deferred Judgment of Conviction Agreement
Deferred Judgment of Conviction Unsigned Agreement
Letter to Judge Thimm from Attorney Mulligan re: adjournment of August 31 hearing

11:41 AM Defendant Derick Matthew Ehrlichmann appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan Sr. appeared by video for Derick Matthew Ehrlichmann.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim appears via video. Court calls case. State indicates plea offer made. Asks for status. Attorney Mulligan has motion to dismiss scheduled, will reject plea. Asks for hearing on motion to dismiss. Court notes no motion filed. Court sets trial date.
Jury trial scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:35 AM Defendant Derick Matthew Ehrlichmann appeared by telephone.  Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan Sr. appeared by video for Derick Matthew Ehrlichmann.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim appears via video. State asks for another status based on defendant's new retention of counsel. Attorney Mulligan asks for another status in 30 days. State indicates that they will send an offer to the defense. Victim does not wish to make a statement. Court sets new status date and reminds defendant to appear with video at the next appearance.
Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 107753,
Payable Number: 148340,
Receipt Number: 22R 006595,
Amount: $20.00

1:49 PM Defendant Derick Matthew Ehrlichmann in court.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Address verified as correct.  Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties. Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court accepts pleas. 
State requests signature bond, no contact with victim 1. 
Court orders 1000 signature bond, with conditions of no contact with Victim 1.
Defendant will retain counsel. Defendant advised of waiver of attorney form.
Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
